title: can anyone explain exactly what it means to drop or withdraw a subject
content:
im in fourth sem and i'm thinking of dropping my special topic. i'm not doing that great in the core subjects itself right now and i don't want to risk losing the scholarship by messing up the special topic.

i heard you cant get scholarships if you fail a subject. is it the same if you drop or withdraw?

what do they even mean exactly. do you think it's something worth doing

comments.body: If you withdraw a subject you don't need to write ESA for that subject and you can clear it as a backlog
will it be counted in my sgpa calculation? will it be like (existing + 0\*2 credits/existing +2 credits)
It will be shown as withheld and will be updated once you clear the exam
you can drop a spl topic no problem
but what if you drop a subject?
You can but they wouldn't recommend you to do so because at a later point of time you may find it difficult to cover it in backlogs due to other commitments in your semester.

wait so if i drop in my first year at some point during the entire 4 years i will have to write the exam?
there’s no never writing eh exam concept?
They won't give you your degree if you have any pending backlogs
so there’s is no difference between drop and withdrawal no matter what at some point imma have to write ?
if i drop constitution will i have to write it again
Bro you can't drop a fundamental course (fc) , it will be considered as backlog
